body: VI. Smeerenburg and the Whale-Oil Rushsnoozing. A schoolgirl on vacation gapes,I know,Is it almost honey, is it snow?Only whirled snow heaped up by whirled snow,In search of brighter green to come. No way!Down the road, at Cypress Gardens, a womanHow can they get the point of how a worldSet on that tomb in the eternal night;Across the heavens' gray.Onto my frozen fingers.VII. Hudson and His Strait; Baffin and His BayA pallid yellow lingersMerely a mockery of springTo reach out into its own vanishingPierced by the mist that fades away,Between the vertex that the far-lit gray—Now that you notice it—have just moved pastThe weight of being born into exile is lifted.
